definition: to lose one's life
mourning/funeral/(old) corpse
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: Chan Fuquan designs circumvent, make Dong Shaohua get killed.
sentences.chinese: 單福全設計陷害，使得董邵華喪命。

sentences.english: He received severe injuries and nearly lost his life during the Second World War.
sentences.chinese: 在第二次世界大戰期間他身負重傷險些喪命。

sentences.english: In February she nearly died after eating a lightbulb.
sentences.chinese: 在今年2月份，她就因喫下燈泡險些喪命。

sentences.english: Betrayed by his friends, nearly to death.
sentences.chinese: 曾因同伴背叛險些喪命，後爲蠻幽王所救。

sentences.english: But if it is eaten by a man, it can kill with its deadly poison .
sentences.chinese: 但是如果人吃了它，有可能會因花的劇毒而喪命。

sentences.english: The number of net entanglements has dramatically increased.
sentences.chinese: 因爲被魚網纏住而喪命的海獅數量明顯增加。

sentences.english: Officials say a Taliban fighter was killed in the battle.
sentences.chinese: 有關官員說，一名塔利班武裝分子在戰鬥中喪命。

sentences.english: Premature crystallization would clog up their silk glands, which would likely prove fatal to the little creatures.
sentences.chinese: 而過早的結晶會阻塞絲腺，蠶很可能爲此喪命。

sentences.english: Seal experts worry that KP2 risks loving people to death.
sentences.chinese: 海豹專家擔心，KP2可能會讓那些愛他的人喪命。

sentences.english: A prizefighter could be seriously injured or even killed during a match.
sentences.chinese: 職業拳擊手有可能在比賽中受到重傷，甚至喪命。

sentences.english: And if there's one thing Achilles wants, it's me, dead.
sentences.chinese: 如果阿基里斯還有一個願望的話，那就是讓我喪命。

sentences.english: His warnings went unheeded , and Tagge died when the Death Star was destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 他的警告未獲注意，因此塔吉於死星爆炸時喪命。

sentences.english: The expedition ended in tragedy, with all hands lost at sea.
sentences.chinese: 這次探險以慘禍告終，所有的人員都在海上喪命了。

sentences.english: Robbery always claims the life of the robber.
sentences.chinese: 打家劫舍的人往往自己喪命。
儘管如此，仍有2000餘人喪命。

definition: to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
seriously hurt/serious injury
to inflict heavy losses/to inflict serious damage
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
to rescue/to be rescued
to take one's last breath/dying
a suicide/to commit suicide
to die in an accident or disaster/to be killed
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
casualties/injuries and deaths
critical circumstances/risky conditions/danger zone
condition of an injury
to fall off or jump off a building
tragedy/calamity/atrocity
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
